com.team1389.hardware.inputs.interfaces

Interface ScalarInput<T extends Value>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Used to make sure of the type of a stream in certain spots in the code
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.Double>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AngleOut, DashboardScalarInput, DashboardScalarInput, ListeningScalarInput, PercentOut, RangeOut, Timer

    public interface ScalarInput<T extends Value>
extends java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.Double>
    This class represents a double input stream and contains a number of static methods for manipulating these streams.
    Author:
    Josh

    • Method Detail

      • get

        java.lang.Double get()
        Specified by:
        get in interface java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.Double>
        Returns:
        The current value of this stream.

      • mapToRange

        static <T extends Value> ScalarInput<T> mapToRange(ScalarInput<T> in,
                                                   double inMin,
                                                   double inMax,
                                                   double outMin,
                                                   double outMax)
        Maps a stream proportionally to a new range from a given range. Note that if initially a number is outside of the given range, it will be outside the new range of the resultant stream too.
        Parameters:
        in - The stream to operate on
        inMin - The minimum of the input stream range
        inMax - The maximum of the input stream range
        outMin - The minimum of the output stream range
        outMax - The maximum of the output stream range
        Returns:
        The new stream mapped to the new range

      • mapToAngle

        static <T extends Value> ScalarInput<T> mapToAngle(ScalarInput<T> in,
                                                   double inMin,
                                                   double inMax)
        maps the given stream from any range to degrees (0 to 360)
        Parameters:
        in - the stream to operate on
        inMin - the original min value
        inMax - the original max value
        Returns:
        the mapped output, now an angle stream

      • mapToPercent

        static <T extends Value> ScalarInput<Percent> mapToPercent(ScalarInput<?> in,
                                                           double outMin,
                                                           double outMax)
        Maps a stream proportionally to a percent. The assumed initial min and max are 1 and -1, so it returns a value mapped between the outMin and outMax proportional to its location between 1 and -1.
        Parameters:
        in - The stream to operate on
        outMin - The minimum of the output stream range
        outMax - The maximum of the output stream range
        Returns:
        The new stream mapped a a percent between outmin and outmax. Now of type Percent

      • invert

        static <T extends Value> ScalarInput<T> invert(ScalarInput<T> in)
        Parameters:
        in - The stream to operate on
        Returns:
        The negated stream

      • applyDeadband

        static <T extends Value> ScalarInput<T> applyDeadband(ScalarInput<T> in,
                                                      double deadband)
        Applies a deadband, a space around zero so close it should be considered as such, to the stream.
        Parameters:
        in - The stream to operate on
        deadband - If the magnitude of this stream is less than the magnitude of the value of this parameter, the stream returns zero
        Returns:
        The stream with the applied deadband

      • limitRange

        static <T extends Value> ScalarInput<T> limitRange(ScalarInput<T> in,
                                                   double min,
                                                   double max)
        confines the given stream within the given range if the stream's value is outside the range, it will be replaced with the nearest edge of the range
        Parameters:
        in - the stream to operate on
        max - the max value of the limit range
        min - the min value of the limit range
        Returns:
        the limited stream (does not change the value type)

      • getListeningInput

        static <T extends Value> ScalarInput<T> getListeningInput(ScalarInput<T> in,
                                                          java.lang.Runnable onChange)
        Listens for a change
        Parameters:
        in - The stream to operate on
        onChange - What to run when a change happens
        Returns:
        The resultant stream with the change listener applied. It still does return the current value.

      • scale

        static <T extends Value> ScalarInput<T> scale(ScalarInput<T> input,
                                              double factor)
        Parameters:
        input - The stream to operate on
        factor - The number to multiply the stream by
        Returns:
        A stream with the input stream multiplied by the factor.

      • getWrapped

        static <T extends Value> ScalarInput<T> getWrapped(ScalarInput<T> input,
                                                   double min,
                                                   double max)
        Wraps a number down to between min and max.
        Parameters:
        input - Stream to operate on
        min - The mimimum of the new range
        max - The maximum of the new range
        Returns:
        A stream that is the modulo of the distance between max and min added to the min.

      • sum

        static <T extends Value> ScalarInput<T> sum(ScalarInput<T> input,
                                            ScalarInput<T> input2)
        adds together the values of the two input streams to produce a new stream
        Parameters:
        input - Stream 1 to operate on
        input2 - Stream 2 to operate on
        Returns:
        The sum of input streams one and two
